topics.body:
So that Net Neutrality thing is happening tomorrow to save the internet and such like that.

Is there a way to fined out how many people have signed the petition yet? How many do we need to make a difference?
topics.author: 50c204917f123b31440000a5

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54ed8eeb63687268e5cd0e00#post_54ed8eeb63687268e5cd0e00
Dont sign. Handing regulatory oversight to the government to solve a problem that was caused by the government, when perfectly good technology is coming out to address the issue (google fiber), is killing the golden goose.

It simply establishes precedent for the government to extert more influence. As it does whenever it gets authority over something. 

And like I said, the issue with our carriers was caused by the government in the 30s when they granted monopoly powers to wire up the country. 
Moreover, the issue it is looking to solve... Has not happened. The story of Netflix is actually a completely unrelated issue.
You're not saving anything because there is no fire.

The issues of federal control probably wont come to pass for a while because incremental creep is how these thibgs usually happen

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54eda8b86368720f05034900#post_54eda8b86368720f05034900
Dude; not all governmental oversight is inherently bad.  While we all shit on the FCC it weren't for them companies could block access to the internet and force you to use internet provider services by their own company in hotels or such, they could still block torrents and such.

While I do agree that over-regulation is a problem having no regulation is also a problem.  No regulation is like a car without a brake, over-regulation is like a car without a gas peddal; the amount of regulation needed is like the speed limit in either you let up on regulation and speed up or you press on the brake so you don't go careening into the a oncoming vehicle at 120mp/h.

How much regulation is required?  Depends on the industry, the company and the times.  To use an analogy police are a form of regulation; without them society would be fucked and on the other hand a police state is bad also; you don't want anarchy and you don't want 1984.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
